Name: California Snow Azalea
Description: Large double. Good grower, heavy bloomer. Early to mid-season, acid loving plants. Plant in moist well-drained soil with pH of 4.0-5.5.
Tags: flowering, acid-loving, moist soil, spring bloomer, white flowers

Name: Tibouchina
Description: Beautiful large royal purple flowers adorn attractive satiny green leaves that turn orange/red in cold weather. Grows up to 18 feet, or prune annually to shorten.
Tags: purple flowers, color-changing foliage, tall, pruning required, tropical

Name: Haight Ashbury Hibiscus
Description: Blooms in summer, 20-35 inches high. Fertilize regularly for best results. Full sun, drought tolerant.
Tags: summer bloomer, compact, full sun, drought-tolerant, tropical

Name: Mona Lavender Plectranthus
Description: Quick-growing, herbaceous shrub reaching up to 30 inches in height, forming a rounded, dense bush.
Tags: fast-growing, herbaceous, compact, rounded shape, purple flowers

Name: Dr Burnside Camellia
Description: Slow growing, upright to spreading shrub. Oval, glossy leaves and profuse winter to spring blooming flowers.
Tags: slow-growing, evergreen, winter bloomer, spring bloomer, glossy leaves

Name: Bougainvillea
Description: Thorny woody vine scrambles over other plants with their hooked thorns. Pest free.
Tags: vine, thorny, colorful bracts, pest-resistant, tropical

Name: Burgundy Rose
Description: Deep purple colored flowers, bushy rounded growth habit to 3 feet tall. Plant in full sun. Water regularly.

Name: Iceberg Rose
Description: Pure white blooms, bushy rounded growth habit to 3 feet tall. Plant in full sun. Water regularly.
Tags: white flowers, bushy, full sun, regular watering, fragrant

Name: Bonsai Tree
Description: They do not thrive indoors, where the light is too dim, and humidity too low, for them to grow properly.
Tags: miniature, artistic, outdoor, high maintenance, decorative

Name: Blue Legend Calibrachoa
Description: Blooms continuously from early spring to first frost. Full sun or part shade, moist well-drained soil.

Name: Cymbidium Orchid
Description: The flowers last about ten weeks. They have a waxy texture and reach a height of more than 20 inches.

Name: Flowering Kale

Name: Penny Orange Jump Up Viola

Name: Pincushion Plant

Name: Ivy-Leaved Geranium

Name: Blue Shades Pansy
Description: Compact mounds of colorful dainty flowers, good for window boxes. Fertile well-drained soil.

Description: Compact mounds of colorful dainty flowers, good for window boxes. Fertile well-drained soil.
Tags: compact, mounding, yellow flowers, blotched, window box

Name: Purple Phalaenopsis Orchid
Description: Choose the brightest windows in your house for your orchids, place on a humidity tray and spray regularly.
Tags: purple flowers, bright indirect light, high humidity, indoor, exotic

Name: Dianthus
Description: They thrive in fertile, fast draining, slightly alkaline (pH 6.75) soil. Avoid over-watering.
Tags: alkaline soil, well-drained, drought-tolerant, fragrant, pink flowers

Name: Bronze Mums
Description: Chrysanthemums respond to plenty of food and moisture, and prefer full sun.

Name: Sea Pink
Description: Summer flowering, 12-18 inches high, likes full sun and well-drained soil. Drought tolerant.

Name: Scarlet Sage
Description: Grows to 15 inches. The species is easy to grow from seeds or cuttings. This species prefers full sun.
Tags: red flowers, full sun, easy to grow, compact, hummingbird-friendly

Name: Headbourne Agapanthus
Description: Easily grown, tolerant of drought and poor soil, flower and foliage improves with feeding. Full sun.

Name: Siberian Iris
Description: These plants are very hardy, easy to grow, and increase readily. Average flower size is 3-4 inches in diameter.

Name: White Wedding Chrysanthemum
Description: Chrysanthemums grow best and produce the most flowers if they are planted in full sunshine.

Name: Dusty Miller
Description: Grown primarily for its attractive silver-gray foliage rather than its yellow flowers. Drought tolerant.

Name: Red Cactus
Description: Add water until there is half inch of dry soil on the surface. Do not water again until the soil is completely dry.

Name: Aloe Vera

Name: Exotic Dancer Christmas Cactus

Name: String of Pearls

Name: Living Stones
Description: These plants blend in among the stones as a means of protection. Grazing animals would otherwise eat them.

Name: Mexican Fencepost Cactus
Description: The Mexican Fence Post will eventually reach 20 feet tall. Protect the growing tips with Styrofoam cups on the tops.
Tags: columnar, tall, architectural, full sun, drought-tolerant

Name: Mexican Golden Barrel Cactus
Description: Growing as a large roughly spherical globe, it may eventually reach over a meter in height after many years.
Tags: spherical, slow-growing, golden spines, full sun, drought-tolerant

Name: Bunny Ears Cactus
Description: The plants should be kept almost completely dry during the winter months, once a month should be fine.
Tags: padded, drought-tolerant, full sun, low-water, unique shape
